critique: This document is an executive order from 1934 that withdraws land in Alaska for use as an addition to the Cordova Aviation Landing Field. It does not seem to have any significant ideological tilt. It does not deal with immigration. It is a fairly minor expansion of executive power, reserving land for a specific purpose, but it does include the caveat that it can be revoked by the President or Congress. It involves the federal government managing land in a territory, so it leans towards federal control. It does not directly address national security or civil liberties. It has a very minor impact on economic regulation, simply reserving land. It does not directly address social inclusion.
